article_title: Man Forces Women Into "Bear Hug" Near Arcadia Schools
article_text:
Police are looking for a man who groped two women Arcadia. (Published Thursday, Aug. 27, 2015)

Police on Thursday released a sketch of a person suspected of forcing two women into a "bear hug" and groping them near schools in Arcadia within a two-hour period.

Both assaults were reported Tuesday morning, the first near Dana Middle School, and the second two hours later at Arcadia High School, Arcadia police said.

Police said the man approached two women from behind as they were either walking to or away from their cars and placed them in a "bear hug" without saying a word.

The victims felt several pelvic thrusts from behind before being released, police said. The man then ran away.

Women Groped Near Arcadia Schools

Police are searching for the person who approached two women in separate incidents near Arcadia schools, forced them into a "bear hug" and pushed himself against them before running away. Lolita Lopez reports for the NBC4 News at Noon on Thursday, Aug. 27, 2015. (Published Thursday, Aug. 27, 2015)

The attacker is described as an Asian male, 16 to 20 years old, black hair, clean-shaven, 5 feet 7 inches tall and "chubby." He was wearing a black hooded sweatshirt with tan shorts.

Anyone with information about what police are calling battery was asked to call the Arcadia Police Department at 626-574-5150.

Police Search for Alleged Sexual Assault Suspect in Arcadia

Police were searching for a man suspected of sexually assaulting two women in Arcadia when he grabbed the women from behind. Adrian Arambulo reports for NBC4 Today in LA on Wednesday, Aug. 27, 2015. (Published Thursday, Aug. 27, 2015)

Adrian Arambulo and Lolita Lopez contributed to this report.
